page.title: 15BUILT IN GLENLUCE
page.content: The majority of the buildings in the {Main Street}are{old in design}with {thick limestone walls.}Many of them date from the 17th and 18th centuries. One hotel was used as an old{coaching {inn,}and a certain house is dated {1790.}Some of the public buildings still in use were built in the nineteenth century.Two Council schemes were built before the{2nd World War. The last Council schemes were built especially with O.A.P.'s in mind. There is no privately owned housing estate. The majority of people live in old privately owned property or non- council rented houses. One Council scheme won the{Civic Trust Award}in {1962}for its design. Several Council tenants have purchased their own council houses to become property owners. The privately owned houses are all well decorated on the outside.
